news.title: Ireland 'in the dark' over fate of pharma in Trump tariff deal
news.summary: There is enormous confusion in Government and the EU about what products will be covered by the baseline 15pc tariff which activates on Friday following the US trade deal.

news.title: Surge in judicial reviews a ‘growing threat’ to housing delivery, Cabinet will be told
news.summary: A surge in legal challenges to major housing and infrastructure projects are a “growing threat” to delivery and causing major delays, ministers will be told today.

news.title: Kingdom officials confident that Jack O’Connor will stay on in Kerry hot seat
news.summary: Kerry GAA officials remain confident they can convince Jack O’Connor to stay on for another year as the Kingdom supremo said he “won’t keep people hanging on” before making up his mind on his plans.

news.title: Gunman kills four, including police officer, in shooting at New York City office tower
news.summary: A man stalked through a Manhattan office tower firing a rifle on Monday, killing four people, including a New York City police officer, and wounding a fifth before taking his own life.

news.title: ‘We need support for indigenous Irish businesses’ – distillery boss says 15pc tariffs would be ‘extremely challenging’
news.summary: Managing director of family business Boann Distillery, Pat Cooney, said if Irish whiskey is hit with 15pc tariffs, there will be a “serious” impact, as he calls on the Government to back “indigenous” business following Donald Trump’s trade deal with the EU.

news.title: ‘We had a ringside view of the Dublin riots, and it was shocking’ – Luas operators on being the eyes of city tram system
news.summary: From the outside, the headquarters of Luas operator Transdev resembles most office blocks in Dublin. But inside, a small team co-ordinates and monitors every Luas tram in motion, giving it a ringside view of every aspect of city life, including the infamous riots in 2023.

news.title: ‘My partner and I gave each other a life interest in our house. But now he’s seriously ill and I’m worried his children could force me out’
news.summary: Query:  My partner and I bought a house together a few years ago. We’re not married, and between us we have children from previous relationships.

news.title: Seán McGinley: ‘It was inevitable... but we were dancing around each other for a long time before we actually got together’
news.summary: Actor Seán McGinley (69) lives in Dublin with his wife, actress Marie Mullen, with whom he has two daughters. McGinley has appeared in numerous theatre, film and TV productions, including ‘The Field’, ‘Michael Collins’, ‘Braveheart’, ‘Family’ and  ‘ The Butcher Boy’.

news.title: The Irish Independent’s View: Donald Trump’s trade victory over EU has wider implications
news.summary: A trade war has been averted – but at what cost? US president Donald Trump and European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen agreed a US tariff on all EU goods of 15pc. But there are no reciprocal tariffs from the EU side.

news.title: Suspect in €94m laundering probe is extradited from the US
news.summary: The extradition from the US of a 44-year-old man who was remanded in custody in Dublin on Monday is the latest development in the gardaí’s long-running Operation Skein.
